title: Temperature
text: Growing degree day can calculated several ways: Method B: Linear GDD=(Tmax+Tmin)2−TbaseGDD = \frac{(T_{max} + T_{min})}{2} - T_{base} Methods B differ way handling daily minimum maximum air temperatures. method , comparison base temperature occurs calculating average temperature whereas method B, comparison base temperature made calculating average air temperature using following rules [@mcmaster_growing_1997]: Tmax<TbaseT_{max} < T_{base} , Tmax=TbaseT_{max} = T_{base} Tmin<TbaseT_{min} < T_{base} , Tmin=TbaseT_{min} = T_{base} ’s , ’s important specify method used calculate GDD. Method C: Triangle Method D: Trapezoidal Rate develoment function temperature different growing degree-days (GDD) methods. Cumulative growing degree-days (GDD) calculated different methods.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Benoit Vasseur. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Vasseur B (2025). weatheR: Weather climate analysis. R package version 0.1.0, https://github.com/vasseurbenoit/weatheR.
code: @Manual{,   title = {weatheR: Weather and climate analysis},   author = {Benoit Vasseur},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://github.com/vasseurbenoit/weatheR}, }

title: Weather and climate analysis
text: goal weatheR provide functions help analyzing visualizing weather climatic data. c functions climate. e functions ETP. r functions radiation. t functions temperature. z functions tools.

title: Weather and climate analysis
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("vasseurbenoit/weatheR")

title: Weather and climate analysis
text: basic example shows solve common problem: Ombrothermic diagram Lexington Blue Grass Airport.
code:
# Library library(weatheR)  # ETP e_evapotranspiration_fao56(altitude = 30,                            R_inc = 5,                            T_air_moy = 20,                            T_air_min = 10,                            T_air_max = 30) #> [1] 3.56085  # Radiation r_radiation_inc_fao56(longitude = 10,                       latitude = 35,                       altitude = 30,                       date = "2022-11-04",                       T_air_min = 5,                       T_air_max = 15) #> [1] 4.494582  # Temperature t_growing_degree_days(T_air_avg = 15,                       T_base = 5,                       T_opt = 10,                       T_max = 20,                       method = "C") #> $rate_of_development #> [1] 0.5 #>  #> $growing_degree_days #> [1] 7.5  # Climate c_ombrothermic_diagram(data = weather_blue_grass_airport,                        year_start = 1991,                        year_end = 2020,                        source = "Blue Grass Airport (Lexington)") #> $table #> # A tibble: 48 × 4 #>    month  rain variable                        value #>    <ord> <dbl> <chr>                           <dbl> #>  1 Jan    86.6 "Average air
temperature (°C)"   0.7 #>  2 Jan    86.6 "Minimum air
temperature (°C)"  -3.8 #>  3 Jan    86.6 "Maximum air
temperature (°C)"  10.6 #>  4 Jan    86.6 "Number of
freezing day"         6.7 #>  5 Feb    91.2 "Average air
temperature (°C)"   2.9 #>  6 Feb    91.2 "Minimum air
temperature (°C)"  -2.1 #>  7 Feb    91.2 "Maximum air
temperature (°C)"  14.1 #>  8 Feb    91.2 "Number of
freezing day"         3.9 #>  9 Mar   113.  "Average air
temperature (°C)"   7.4 #> 10 Mar   113.  "Minimum air
temperature (°C)"   2   #> # ℹ 38 more rows #>  #> $diagram

title: c_ombrothermic_diagram — c_ombrothermic_diagram
text: Plot ombrothermic diagram set weather data. y scale, one temperature unit equals two rain unit. correct, 30 years must selected statistical analysis.

title: c_ombrothermic_diagram — c_ombrothermic_diagram
code: c_ombrothermic_diagram(data, year_start, year_end, source)

title: c_ombrothermic_diagram — c_ombrothermic_diagram
text: data Dataframe columns date, rain, T_air_max T_air_min respectively date day, rain (mm) maximum minimum temperature (°C). year_start Start year begin statical analysis. year_end End year finish statical analysis. source Source data.

title: c_ombrothermic_diagram — c_ombrothermic_diagram
text: List table diagram. table used build ombrothermic plot.

title: c_ombrothermic_diagram — c_ombrothermic_diagram
code: output <- c_ombrothermic_diagram(data = weather_blue_grass_airport,                                  year_start = 1991,                                  year_end = 2020,                                  source = "Blue Grass Airport (Lexington)")

title: c_weather_anomaly — c_weather_anomaly
text: correct, 30 years must selected statistical analysis.

title: c_weather_anomaly — c_weather_anomaly
code: c_weather_anomaly(   data,   year_start,   year_end,   months,   day_start,   day_end,   years,   source,   plot_type = 1 )

title: c_weather_anomaly — c_weather_anomaly
text: data Dataframe columns date, rain, T_air_max T_air_min respectively date day, rain (mm) maximum minimum temperature (°C). year_start Starting year begin statical analysis. year_end End year finish statical analysis. months Vector month take account. day_start Start day begin statical analysis. day_end End day finish statical analysis. years vector selection years potential anomaly. Selected years must range years selected year_start year_end. source Source data. plot_type 1 rain ratio mean, 2 rain absolute value

title: c_weather_anomaly — c_weather_anomaly
text: List data_thirthy_years_avg, data_selected_years plot_selected_years, df thirthy years average temperature rainfall, df average temperature rainfall selected years plot selected years.

title: c_weather_anomaly — c_weather_anomaly
code: output <- c_weather_anomaly(data = weather_blue_grass_airport,                             year_start = 1990,                             year_end = 2019,                             months = c(9,10,11,12,1,2,3),                             day_start = 1,                             day_end = 31,                             years = c(2020,2021,2022,2023),                             source = "Blue Grass Airport (Lexington)")

title: Evapotranspiration de reference — e_evapotranspiration_fao56
text: Evapotranspiration de reference

title: Evapotranspiration de reference — e_evapotranspiration_fao56
code: e_evapotranspiration_fao56(   altitude,   R_inc,   T_air_moy,   T_air_min,   T_air_max,   vent = 2,   pression_vapeur = z_pression_vapeur_saturante(T_air_min),   a = NA,   b = NA )

title: Evapotranspiration de reference — e_evapotranspiration_fao56
text: Irrigation drainage paper, Allen & (1998)

title: Evapotranspiration de reference — e_evapotranspiration_fao56
text: altitude Altitude de la localisation d'etude (m) R_inc rayonnement incident du jour (MJ/m^2/j) T_air_moy temperature moyenne du jour (celcius) T_air_min temperature minimale du jour (celcius) T_air_max temperature maximale du jour (celcius) vent vitesse du vent 2 m (m/s). Valeur par defaut egale 2 m/s d'apres p63 Allan & . 1998. pression_vapeur calcul interne partir de la temperature minimale : T_point_rosee = T_air_min d'apres Allan & . 1998. Parametre correctif facultatif de Evapotranspiration corrige = . Evapotranspiration + b. b Parametre correctif facultatif de Evapotranspiration corrige = . Evapotranspiration + b.

title: Evapotranspiration de reference — e_evapotranspiration_fao56
text: Evapotranspiration de reference (mm)

title: Evapotranspiration de reference — e_evapotranspiration_fao56
code: # Without correction e_evapotranspiration_fao56(altitude = 30,                            R_inc = 5,                            T_air_moy = 20,                            T_air_min = 10,                            T_air_max = 30) #> [1] 3.56085  # With correction e_evapotranspiration_fao56(altitude = 30,                            R_inc = 5,                            T_air_moy = 20,                            T_air_min = 10,                            T_air_max = 30,                            a = 1.2,                            b = 2) #> [1] 6.27302

what: Calcul du rayonnement incident net — r_radiation_inc_fao56
title: Calcul du rayonnement incident net — r_radiation_inc_fao56
text: Calcul du rayonnement incident net

title: Calcul du rayonnement incident net — r_radiation_inc_fao56
code: r_radiation_inc_fao56(   longitude,   latitude,   altitude,   date,   T_air_min,   T_air_max,   albedo = 0.23,   a = NA,   b = NA )

title: Calcul du rayonnement incident net — r_radiation_inc_fao56
text: Irrigation drainage paper, Allen & (1998)

title: Calcul du rayonnement incident net — r_radiation_inc_fao56
text: longitude Longitude de la localisation d'etude (°) latitude Latitude de la localisation d'etude (°) altitude Altitude de la localisation d'etude (m) date date au format "Y-m-d" T_air_min temperature minimale du jour (celcius) T_air_max temperature maximale du jour (celcius) albedo albedo du gazon hypothetique de reference egale 0.23 Eq. 38 Allan & . 1998. Parametre correctif facultatif de l'equation Rayonnement net corrige = . Rayonemment net + b. b Parametre correctif facultatif de l'equation Rayonnement net corrige = . Rayonemment net + b.

title: Calcul du rayonnement incident net — r_radiation_inc_fao56
text: Rayonnement net (MJ/m^2)

title: Calcul du rayonnement incident net — r_radiation_inc_fao56
code: # Without correction r_radiation_inc_fao56(longitude = 10,                       latitude = 35,                       altitude = 30,                       date = "2022-11-04",                       T_air_min = 5,                       T_air_max = 15) #> [1] 4.494582  # With correction r_radiation_inc_fao56(longitude = 10,                       latitude = 35,                       altitude = 30,                       date = "2022-11-04",                       T_air_min = 5,                       T_air_max = 15,                       a = 1.2,                       b = 2) #> [1] 7.393499

title: t_fahrenheit_celcius — t_fahrenheit_celcius
text: Conversion degree Fahrenheit intp degree celcius vice-versa.

title: t_fahrenheit_celcius — t_fahrenheit_celcius
code: t_fahrenheit_celcius(T_air_celcius = NA, T_air_fahrenheit = NA)

title: t_fahrenheit_celcius — t_fahrenheit_celcius
text: T_air_celcius Air temperature (°C). T_air_fahrenheit Air temperature (°F).

title: t_fahrenheit_celcius — t_fahrenheit_celcius
text: Converted air temperature.

title: t_fahrenheit_celcius — t_fahrenheit_celcius
code: # From fahrenheit to celcius t_fahrenheit_celcius(T_air_fahrenheit = 72) #> [1] 22.22222  # From celcius to fahrenheit t_fahrenheit_celcius(T_air_celcius = 22) #> [1] 71.6

title: Growing degree days calculation — t_growing_degree_days
text: Calculation daily thermal unit. Two methods available. Method - linear - small grains: use T_air_avg T_base. Method widely used calculation daily thermal unit small grain cereals simulation models. Method B - linear: use T_air_min, T_air_max T_base. Method widely used calculation daily thermal unit corn. Method C - triangle: use T_air_avg, T_base, T_opt T_max. Method D - trapezoid: use T_air_avg, T_base, T_opt_1, T_opt_2 T_max.

title: Growing degree days calculation — t_growing_degree_days
code: t_growing_degree_days(   T_air_avg,   T_air_min = NA,   T_air_max = NA,   T_base,   T_opt = NA,   T_opt_1 = NA,   T_opt_2 = NA,   T_max = NA,   method = "A" )

title: Growing degree days calculation — t_growing_degree_days
text: T_air_avg Average air temperature (°C). Required methods , C, D. T_air_min Minimum air temperature (°C). Required method B . T_air_max Maximum air temperature (°C). Required method B . T_base Base air temperature crop (°C) T_opt Optimum air temperature crop (°C) T_opt_1 First optimum temperature crop (°C) T_opt_2 Second optimum temperature crop (°C) T_max Maximum air temperature crop (°C) method Selection calculation method: Method : Linear - small grains Method B: Linear - corn Method C: Triangle Method D: Trapezoidal

title: Growing degree days calculation — t_growing_degree_days
text: Daily thermal unit (°Cj)

title: Growing degree days calculation — t_growing_degree_days
code: # Method A - linear - small grains t_growing_degree_days(T_air_avg = 15,                       T_base = 5,                       method = "A") #> $rate_of_development #> [1] 1 #>  #> $growing_degree_days #> [1] 15 #>   # Method B - linear - corn t_growing_degree_days(T_air_min = 15,                       T_air_max = 25,                       T_base = 10,                       method = "B") #> $rate_of_development #> [1] 1 #>  #> $growing_degree_days #> [1] 20 #>   # Method C - triangle t_growing_degree_days(T_air_avg = 15,                       T_base = 5,                       T_opt = 10,                       T_max = 20,                       method = "C") #> $rate_of_development #> [1] 0.5 #>  #> $growing_degree_days #> [1] 7.5 #>   # Method D - trapezoidal t_growing_degree_days(T_air_avg = 15,                       T_base = 5,                       T_opt_1 = 12,                       T_opt_2 = 18,                       T_max = 20,                       method = "D") #> $rate_of_development #> [1] 1 #>  #> $growing_degree_days #> [1] 15 #>
